title: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. life insurers, as expected, made a large number of Covid-19 death-benefit payouts last year, with many seeing a jump in other death claims, too.

---

Barclays said it has frozen former CEO Jes Staley 's deferred pay while regulators complete a probe into how he characterized his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

---

A judge said she would pause the trial of Roger Ng after prosecutors said they had failed to turn over a tranche of documents to the former Goldman banker's lawyers.

---

Ford 's CEO said the auto maker doesn't intend to spin off its electric-vehicle business, tamping down speculation that the company could break off its EV operations to boost market value.

---

The EU is proposing legislation that would force more data sharing among companies in Europe, aiming to loosen the grip officials say a few big tech firms have on some commercial and industrial data.

---

Lowe's surprised Wall Street with its management of costs and pricing in the latest quarter amid a slowing outlook for the home-improvement sector's sales.

---

Estee Lauder suspended a top executive without pay following a backlash over a post on his personal Instagram account.
